intro: Cochlearia serpens, commonly known as the snake's head or serpentine cochlearia, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of tiny, white or pink flowers. It thrives in rocky, coastal, or alpine environments, often growing in open, sunny areas. Cochlearia serpens is adapted to cold climates and is typically found in regions with short growing seasons.
